fields.name: [LOCAL] Frank F. Conlon Fellowship
fields.description: Applicants must be enrolled in a University of Washington graduate program and qualify for financial aid in the academic year of application.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Pride Foundation Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a high school senior or college student. Applicants must be a resident of Alaska, Idaho, Montana, Oregon or Washington but may study elsewhere. Preference is given to students who are self-identified LGBTQ, members of LGBTQ families, or straight allies who have been strongly supportive of the LGBTQ community. All scholarships emphasize demonstrated commitment to equality and civil rights for all people. (Over 50 scholarships by filling out just ONE application)

fields.name: [LOCAL] Mount Baker Community Club MLK Scholarship
fields.description: High school senior, must be a minority, must reside or go to school in the area codes: 9810498108, 98118, 98122, 98134, 98144

fields.name: [LOCAL] Education First Scholarship
fields.description: High school senior from Cleveland, Chief Sealth, or Rainer Beach High School in Seattle, We guarantee at least one interview for each high school.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Annual Arevalo Scholarship
fields.description: Incoming Chicano(a)/Latino(a) freshman. Priority will be given to Grandview High School students, but students from all high schools may apply. Recipients are required to participate in Las Aguilas Scholars Program and be enrolled in the Chicano(a)/Latino(a) Orientation course during the fall 2016.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Orgullo Latino(a) University Scholarship
fields.description: Incoming freshmen or community college transfers. Recipients of the Orgullo Latino(a) University Scholarship are required to participate in “Las Aguilas” Scholars Program and be enrolled in the Chicano(a)/Latino(a) Orientation course during the fall 2016.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Otto Guardado Scholarship
fields.description: The scholarship will be awarded to any EWU student pursing a major in English, Finance, Economics or Business. Recipients are required to participate in “Las Aguilas” Scholars Program and be enrolled in the Chicano(a)/Latino(a) Orientation Course during Fall quarter 2016.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Wittenbach Scholarship
fields.description: Chicana/Latina EWU continuing students or community college transfers. Students pursing studies in the health sciences are encouraged to apply. Recipients are required to participate in “Las Aguilas” Scholars Program and enroll in the Chicano/Latino Orientation Course during Fall quarter 2016.

fields.name: [LOCAL] CEP University Scholarship
fields.description: Freshmen or community college transfers. These awards can be renewed for one additional year if the student maintains a 3.30 GPA during their first year. Recipients are required to participate in “Las Aguilas” Scholars Program and enroll in the Chicano(a)/Latino(a) Orientation Course during Fall quarter 2016.

fields.name: [LOCAL] WSAJ Contest Scholarship
fields.description: High school seniors, show advocacy in the American justice system, and related issues

fields.name: [LOCAL] ARC of Washington Trust Fund Student Grants
fields.description: Upper division or graduate students in school in the states of Washington, Alaska, Oregon or Idaho. Demonstrated interest in the field of intellectual or other developmental disabilities. Student applicants should have a particular career interest in work relating to mental retardation

fields.name: [LOCAL] Nora Stone Smith ESL Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a former or current ELL/ESL Student, High school senior

fields.name: [LOCAL] City of Destiny Scholarship  (Part of Leadership 1000 Program)
fields.description: A Washington State resident, (qualifying for in-state tuition or eligible for Washington State financial aid programs), living in Tacoma or, will be or already are, a graduate from a Tacoma high school. Planning to attend, or currently attending an eligible four-year college or university, or community or technical college in Washington State. Pursuing a major in science, engineering, energy efficiency, information technology, healthcare sciences, or nursing.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Anne D. Maloof Scholarship
fields.description: To honor and financially assist students in Island, Kitsap, Jefferson and Thurston counties.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Atsuhiko Tateuchi Memorial Scholarship - Tateuchi Foundation
fields.description: Students from the Pacific Rim states (Alaska, California, Hawaii, Oregon and Washington) who demonstrate hard work, dedication and sincerity. undergraduate studies only.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Bernie Minsk Scholarship
fields.description: The Bernie Minsk Scholarship is awarded to graduating public high school seniors who currently work with Rainier Scholars. Priority will be given to seniors who attend Garfield High School in Seattle, WA. All students should demonstrate financial need and a strong interest and commitment to mentoring students in the future.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Bob and Maggie Bergman Scholarship
fields.description: This scholarship is granted to Quilcene High School graduating seniors in Quilcene, WA to provide an incentive to continue education in college or trade school.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Bob and Maggie Bergman Teacher Recognition Scholarship
fields.description: The purpose of this scholarship is to honor and to give financial support to a current teacher in Quilcene or Brinnon School District pursuing continuing education at an accredited educational institution. The Bergman’s have a strong commitment to the quality of education in the Quilcene area, also offering scholarships to students who continue their education at college or university. By offering this scholarship to teachers, they hope to encourage them to increase their skills and enrich their experience which will, in turn, benefit the students and improve the quality of education in the region.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Bobbi McCallum Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: The scholarship is given on the basis of talent, need and the motivation to pursue a journalism career.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Doug Struthers Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: The purpose of the Doug Struthers Memorial Scholarship is to applaud all students who are performing to their highest capabilities. It is in this spirit that a scholarship fund was created in his memory to help young people learn skills to serve their communities.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Doyne M. Green Scholarship
fields.description: To support and honor female graduate students of medicine, law or social and public services. This scholarship is available to students who have completed at least one year of graduate work.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Hawkins Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: The purpose of this scholarship is to honor and to give financial support to graduating seniors currently enrolled at Lake Stevens High School who are pursuing a course of study in life sciences, medicine or pharmacy. Preference will be given to students attending the University of Washington.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Hoshino Family Scholarship
fields.description: The purpose of the Hoshino Family Scholarship is to honor and to give financial support to a deserving senior demonstrating financial need currently enrolled at Seattle Urban Academy, Rainier Beach High School, Technology Access Foundation (TAF) Academy or Cleveland High School.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Joan Hill Scholarship
fields.description: We offer The Joan Hill Scholarship to honor Joan and her ongoing support and encouragement of others.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Lambeth Family Scholarship
fields.description: The purpose of the Lambeth Family Scholarship is to honor and to give financial support to a deserving student pursuing a degree in engineering, natural sciences, mathematics, computer science or business.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Linkous Foundation Scholarship
fields.description: The Linkous Foundation Scholarship was created in memory of Gary L. Linkous (Columbia High School, Class of 1955). This scholarship will provide financial support for college tuition/education expenses to a deserving senior currently enrolled at Richland or Hanford high schools in Richland, Washington.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Walter H. Meyer - Garry L. White Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: This scholarship is directed specifically to returning adult students who are either attending or prepared to attend a 2- or 4-year public or private university, at the graduate or undergraduate level. If attending at the undergraduate level, the applicant must be over the age of 24. If attending at the graduate level, the applicant must be over the age of 30.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Yuri and Tatsuo Nakata Scholarship
fields.description: The purpose of this scholarship is to honor and to give financial support to students of Asian heritage currently enrolled at Roosevelt, Cleveland or Franklin High School in Seattle, Washington.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Washington State PTA Scholarship Program
fields.description: Graduates from Washington State public high schools beginning their freshman year of post-secondary education in the United States

fields.name: [LOCAL] Edith K Draham Scholarship for Fiction
fields.description: Criteria varies with each scholarship. All applicants must be in the English Department at the University of Washington.

fields.name: [LOCAL] English Department Creative Writing Awards
fields.description: Criteria varies with each scholarship. All applicants must be in the English Department at the University of Washington. Contact the Creative Writing Office for information.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Walter H Meyer - Garry L White Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: Be a resident of Washington State and a returning adult students attending or prepared to attend a 2 or 4 year public or private university, at the graduate or undergraduate level. If attending at the undergraduate level applicant must be over the age of 24. If attending at the graduate level applicant must be over the age of 30.

fields.name: [LOCAL] C.E. Boucher Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: Be attending the School of Engineering at the University of Washington, Washington State University, University of Oregon or Oregon State University. Have a cumulative grade point average of 2.5 or better. Be an Oregon or Washington State resident. Be prepared to use the award in the next academic year to continue at the School of Engineering at the University of Washington, Washington State University, University of Oregon or Oregon State University.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Danaca Design Jewelry/ Metal Crafting Scholarship
fields.description: You must be a matriculated student, actively enrolled in a high school or post secondary institution in Washington State. You must be between the ages of 16-24 to qualify. The scholarship is available for new students to Danaca Design only.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Patricia Fisher Endowed Scholarship
fields.description: The scholarship fund will help students of color in the Puget Sound region who are pursuing college careers in journalism. Awards are based on scholastic achievement, financial need, community service and a serious interest in print, photo, broadcast journalism or multimedia/ online

fields.name: [LOCAL] Washington State Scholarship Foundation
fields.description: High school seniors or student with a G.E.D, must be first time entering freshmen. Undocumented students can apply if they submit their parents IRS from 1040 of the taxes 2013.

fields.name: [LOCAL] PSBJs Women of Influence - Lytle Enterprises Scholarship
fields.description: The Women of Influence Awards celebrate the leadership of women in the business world and in the larger community. This scholarship will enable a woman of potential to develop her leadership and business acumen in a local graduate school of business. In addition to providing financial support toward the scholarship winner’s education, the members of our stellar and prestigious Women of Influence advisory board will make themselves available to mentor her, providing her with a truly powerful launching pad.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Women of WSAJ Bar Preparation Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a woman law school grad, must demonstrate financial need, and plan to take bar exam the year of application for scholarship.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Diversity Bar Preparation Scholarship
fields.description: Must be considered part of an under-represented in the legal profession based on disability, gender, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression.

fields.name: [LOCAL] National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences Northwest College Awards for Excellence
fields.description: Any current or former college student who was involved in the production of a video that meets the video criteria is eligible.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Beyond Dreaming Foundation Scholarship
fields.description: Must be an undocumenented Washington State high school senior. Must attend the Beyond HB 1079 Conference

fields.name: [LOCAL] 2016 American Justice Video & Essay Scholarship Program
fields.description: This scholarship is available to high school seniors who are residents of the state of Washington and who attend high school in Washington State. Students need not intend to attend a Washington college, but must start college within the next 2 years to receive the scholarship funds.

fields.name: [LOCAL] American Justice Video Scholarship
fields.description: This scholarship is available to high school seniors who are residents of the state of Washington and who attend high school in Washington State. Students need not intend to attend a Washington college, but must start college within the next 2 years to receive the scholarship funds.

fields.name: [LOCAL] WSAJ Presidents' Scholarship
fields.description: Demonstrated academic achievement and planned advancement toward a degree in an institution of higher learning. A documented need for financial assistance. A history of achievement despite having been a victim of injury or overcoming a disability, handicap, or similar challenge. Residency in Washington State. High school seniors only.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Rita Lowe Scholarship
fields.description: Any high school student, college student, or professional within Washington State majoring in Mathematics Education and pursuing teaching certification in order to become a professional mathematics educator (teaching mathematics at elementary or secondary 1evel) is eligible to apply.

fields.name: [LOCAL] YMCA Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a high school senior who is involved or has been involved in high school program

fields.name: [LOCAL] Aki Kurose Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: High school senior from Seattle Public Schools, must be attending to a Seattle community, technical college OR a Washington state public university, GPA 2.5 or higher

fields.name: [LOCAL] Abe Osheroff and Gunnel Clark Endowed Human Rights Fund for Students
fields.description: All undergraduate and graduate students at the University of Washington (Bothell, Seattle, Tacoma) are eligible to apply.  All hands-on human rights projects are eligible, whether the worl involved human rights issues in the United States or elsewhere in the world.

fields.name: [LOCAL] University of Washington Alumnae Board Scholarship
fields.description: Washington State resident who will be University of Washington Seattle (only) incoming freshmen, sophomores, juniors and seniors. Must have a 3.0 GPA and be considered low-income.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Seattle Metropolitan Credit Union
fields.description: Applicant must be a Seattle Metropolitan Credit Union Member, or a dependent child of a Credit Union Member. Previous scholarship winners are not eligible. Board Members, dependent children of either board directors, or scholarship committee members are not eligible

fields.name: [LOCAL] Association for Women in Communications (AWC) Scholarship
fields.description: Be a registered student at a four-year college in Washington state for fall 2016. Be a junior or senior year in college. Major in at least one communication discipline.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Leadership 1000 Scholarship
fields.description: High school seniors or college students, must attend a 4 year university in the state of Washington. Must have at least a 3.0 GPA

fields.name: [LOCAL] Alden Landis Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: The scholarship is intended for high school students (grades 10-12) who demonstrate financial need and who successfully apply for enrollment in a summer study abroad or service trip run by a 501(c)(3) public charity. Students must demonstrate a commitment to community service and learning about other cultures.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Sea Mar Community Health Center Farm Worker College Scholarship Application
fields.description: Must be a college student who has not previously got the SeaMar high school scholarship. Must show your experiences, hardships, and/or rewards as a member of a farm worker family. Contact at scholarships@seamarchc.org

fields.name: [LOCAL] Sea Mar Community Health Center Farm Worker Scholarship Application
fields.description: Students who work or have worked OR, whose parent/legal guardian is or has worked as a farm worker. High school seniors, incoming college students and college students. Contact at scholarships@seamarchc.org

fields.name: [LOCAL] Robert W. Thunen Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: full-time students who desire to study illumination as a career. Applications for the Thunen Memorial Scholarship may be made by those who will be a junior, senior or graduate student in an accredited four year college or university located in Northern California, Nevada, Oregon or Washington

fields.name: [LOCAL] Willie Stewart Community Service Scholarship
fields.description: Pierce County high school seniors who have given back to their community through volunteer service. For more information, call (253) 597-6685 or email youthunited@uwpc.org.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Lion’s Club of West Seattle
fields.description: High school seniors who live in West Seattle

fields.name: [LOCAL] Gilda's Club Seattle "It's Always Something" Cancer Unwrapped Writing Contest
fields.description: This essay writing contest is for any teen in grades 9 through 12, in Washington State, who has been touched by cancer either through a personal diagnosis or that of a family member or friend.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Edward E. Carlson Student Leadership Award
fields.description: Candidates must be enrolled as a junior or senior at the University of Washington (Bothell, Seattle, and Tacoma) during the current academic year and working toward their first baccalaureate degree. If you have questions about this award, feel free to email engage@uw.edu.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Charlotte Paul Reese Fiction Award
fields.description: Awarded only to a sophomore or junior English major at the University of Washington

fields.name: [LOCAL] Geological Sciences Scholarships and Awards
fields.description: Students must have an overall UW GPA of 3.3. Awards vary in amount from $200 to full in-state tuition for 3 quarters. The awards are disbursed as tuition scholarships, research and field course support for declared Earth and Space Sciences Major

fields.name: [LOCAL] Rotary Club of University District Scholarship
fields.description: Seattle Public School High School Graduates attending community college in 2014 fall

fields.name: [LOCAL] Washington Tech Prep Scholarship
fields.description: High school seniors, attending a Washington State Tech Prep high school, and is entering a Washington State community or technical college in Fall

fields.name: [LOCAL] Seattle First Hill Lions Club Scholarship
fields.description: Seattle Public School High School Graduates attending community college or a university in 2014 fall

fields.name: [LOCAL] Dick Larsen and Herb Robinson Scholarships
fields.description: A past graduate of a Washington high school currently enrolled in a public or private college/university in this state and a graduating Washington high-school senior who is entering a public or private college/university in this state.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Founder's SCholarship & Northwest Journalists of Color Scholarship
fields.description: Scholarship will be accepted from any AAJA student member in Washington State, including graduating seniors.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Foster School of Business Undergraduate Business Scholarships
fields.description: Must be a full-time undergraduate student at the University of Washington (Seattle) Must average 12 credits per quarter over three quarters, for a total of 36 credits during the awarding year. If you plan to study abroad, you must be concurrently enrolled at the UW to be eligible for scholarships.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Seattle-Nantes Dollars for Scholars
fields.description: Students who intend to major in French or Francophone studies, or will minor in French or take at least two full years of courses, or need a concentration in French to support a program of study, and are members of Seattle Nantes Sister City Association.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Sally Heet Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: Interest and aptitude in public relations demonstrated by courses taken, activities and/or internships. Full-time Washington state sophomore or junior in the 2012-2013 academic year pursuing a career in public relations who will be a full-time junior or senior during the 2013-2014 year at a Washington state college or university. Academic achievement.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Fritz Scholarship
fields.description: Funding for study abroad. Student must be UW undergraduate student, Humanities or social science major at the time of application, 3.0 cumulative GPA.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Yakima Valley Human Rights Scholarship
fields.description: GED.Emphasis is given to persons of ethnic minority who exhibit promise in scholarship. Applicants must plan to attend an accredited college, university, business school or trade school.

fields.name: [LOCAL] African American-Jewish Coalition June R. Chaus Scholarship
fields.description: Have been admitted to an approved undergraduate or graduate institution in the Pacific Northwest. Are pursuing studies in human services, health care, education, public affairs or a related field. Are considered to be minority students, based on race, ethnicity, religious affiliation or sexual orientation. Application plus a one page personal essay.

fields.name: [LOCAL] New Car and Truck Dealers Make a Difference Scholarship
fields.description: Only high school seniors enrolled in a Washington State public or private high school, as well as those who are home-schooled and reside in Washington State, are eligible to enter. The Student Information/Release Form must be included which provides student and school information, parent permission and statement of originality from student and a teacher/advisor.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Association for Women in Science Undergraduate Scholarship - Seattle Chapter - Requires Social Security
fields.description: Open to women who will be juniors or seniors at a four-year college or university in the state of Washington in the Fall. Applicants must have a declared major in STEM. Applicants shall have exemplary grades, outstanding letters of recommendation, financial need, a record of community service, and a strong interest in pursuing a career in STEM

fields.name: [LOCAL] Seattle Association of Educational Office Professionals Scholarship
fields.description: All interested and qualified male or female students graduating from a Seattle Public High school who wish to continue their education at a 2 year or 4 year college or vocational school.

fields.name: [LOCAL] HCDE Sakson Diversity Undergraduate Scholarship
fields.description: Current UW student majoring in Human Centered Design & Engineering (HDCE), or current UW student applying to major in HCDE, or applicant to UW and the HCDE program. Full time undergraduate student. Academic achievement. Demonstrated interest/understanding of HCDE. Demonstrated understanding or experience with diverse and/or cultural issues.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Agnes C. Nelson Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: To be eligible for the scholarship, students must: Maintain a cumulative UW GPA of at least 3.2, Have completed a minimum of 25 combined credits in political science and economics with at least 10 credits in each discipline, Have completed 75 credits by the end of Spring.

fields.name: [LOCAL] George and Pearl Corkery Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: Scholarship is awarded on the basis of academic merit to outstanding junior undergraduate students at the University of Washington. Applicants must have been accepted as an Economics major.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Eleanor Davis Pinkham Scholarship
fields.description: The scholarship will be awarded to a Roosevelt High School graduate entering the University of Washington as a freshman. Selection will be based on the student's academic achievement and extracurricular involvement at Roosevelt High School. 3 short essays, a letter of recommendation, and transript are included in the application

fields.name: [LOCAL] Seattle Swedish Community Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a high school senior, attend high school in King County, and reside in King County, Washington. Must submit completed application, transcript, ACT or SAT score, and information about family income (include a copy of pp. 1–2 of 2011 income tax statement), and a self-addressed, stamped envelope in order to receive notification of results. Note: Swedish ancestry not required.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Cleveland High School Alumni Association Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a senior from Cleveland High School

fields.name: [LOCAL] Richard E. Fitzner Memorial Scholarship for Wildlife Biology
fields.description: Of junior or senior standing at a college or university in Washington. Must be  pursuing a degree in Biology or a Biology-related field.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Sewer/Water Utility Scholarship
fields.description: Employee’s, Elected Officials or Immediate family member of WASWD Members or any Washington State Resident. Course work must be related to the sewer and/or water industry. Applicants are encouraged but not required to be sponsored by a Sewer and/or Water District in the area of their residence. Must be a full or part-time student. Attendance at an accredited college, university or technical school. Pursuit of a degree; Associates, Bachelors, Masters or Doctorate

fields.name: [LOCAL] Washington Financial Aid Association Ethnic Awareness Committee Scholarship
fields.description: Students of color enrolled in a WA state college. GPA 3.0 or higher, show leadership

fields.name: [LOCAL] Governors' Scholarship for Foster Youth
fields.description: Be recognized as a dependent youth in foster care or kinship care in Washington State, federal or tribal out-of-home care. Be enrolled as a Washington State high school senior and on track to graduate from high school. Have resided in Washington State for at least three academic years prior to high school graduation. Have a cumulative high school GPA of at least a 2.0

fields.name: [LOCAL] LEAP 1% Scholarship
fields.description: The LEAP1% Scholarship Fund provides financial support for students who demonstrate a history of advocacy, responsibility, accountability, and perseverance; are go-getters, and have shown or have the strong potential to be contributors to their community. All scholarships are open to all aspiring college and graduate students who meet our eligibility requirements below.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Central Washington University - LEAP Scholarship
fields.description: Scholarship is open to students who will attend Central Washington University during the 2016-17 school year. Must meet similar requirements of LEAP1% Scholarship.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Phyllis Gutierrez Kenney Leadership Award
fields.description: Scholarship is named in honor of former Latina state representative Phyllis Gutierrez Kenney and will be awarded to a student who attends North Seattle College during the 2016-17 school year. Must meet similar requirements of LEAP1% Scholarship.

fields.name: [LOCAL] University of Washington Tacoma - LEAP Scholarship
fields.description: Scholarship is open to a student who attends the University of Washington Tacoma during the 2016-17 school year. Must meet similar requirements of LEAP1% Scholarship.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Act 6 Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a high school senior. Undocumented students can apply to Whitworth, Pacific Lutheran, and Trinity Lutheran University. Live in one of the following regions and desire to attend one of the college partners listed for that region: Tacoma-Seattle (Gonzaga, Northwest, PLU, Trinity Lutheran, Whitworth), Spokane (Whitworth, Gonzaga),

fields.name: [LOCAL] The Paul & Daisy Soros Felloships For New Americans
fields.description: The competition is merit-based. Selection criteria emphasize creativity, originality, initiative, and sustained accomplishment. The program values a commitment to the Constitution and the Bill of Rights. The program does not have any quotas for types of degrees, universities or programs, countries of origin, or gender, etc.

fields.name: [LOCAL] P.E.O. Sisterhood - AO Chapter
fields.description: Be female. Display leadership roles in school and/or community. Have a GPA of at least a 3.0. Show financial need. Attend an accredited institution. Preference will be given to those students living in Western Washington and pursuing degrees in health-related fields.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Soroptimist Pasco-Kennewick Violet Richardson Award
fields.description: Young woman between the ages of 14 and 17 who volunteers their community or school in Benton or Franklin counties

fields.name: [LOCAL] Seattle Hiroshima Club
fields.description: One of the student’s parent(s), grandparent(s), great-grandparent(s) or relative must be from Hiroshima Prefecture. The parent or guardian must be a current paid member of the Seattle Hiroshima Club by October 31, 2014. The applicant is graduating from high school and the latest high school transcript reflects a cumulative GPA of 3.8 or higher.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Imagine America Scholarship Program
fields.description: Likelihood of successful completion of postsecondary education, high school grade point average of 2.5 or greater, financial need, and demonstrated voluntary community service during senior year

fields.name: [LOCAL] Friends of Secondary Bilingual Orientation Center
fields.description: Any student who attended the SBOC/Seattle World School since 2007 is eligible for scholarships after graduation from a Seattle high school.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Washington State School Retirees' Association
fields.description: The Washington State School Retirees' Association (WSSRA) invites senior students of your school who have a GPA of 3.0 or higher to apply for the above scholarships. These awards are given to students who wish to have a career in the field of education. Their degree could be in one of these majors: teacher, counselor, speech therapist, occupational therapist, or psychologist.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Kids Chance of Washington
fields.description: This scholarship is available to spouses or children of injured Washington workers whose injury, while at work in Washington State, resulted in a permanent inability to return to work (a pension under the claim) or death. Money is available for college undergraduates, technical school students, high school students participating in a Running Start program, or other accredited schools.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Susan Jane Russell College Scholarship
fields.description: Outstanding high school senior art student who plans on attending a community college, college, university, or art school in the fall of 2014, majoring in the visual arts, arts education or an art related focus.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Jane M. Klausman Scholarship: Women in Business
fields.description: Applicants must apply to their local Zonta Club. Club winners proceed to the District Level where one applicant is chosen to be the District winner and our candidate for one of the International scholarships They will be in their third or fourth year of undergraduate business study. Applicants must demonstrate intent to complete a program in business and show outstanding achievement in business related subjects as recorded on the official university/college/institute transcript.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Fire's Freedom in Academia Essay Contest
fields.description: High school juniors and seniors for the 2015-2016 school year are eligible to participate in FIRE's essay contest.

fields.name: [LOCAL] MALDEF's Law School Scholarship Program
fields.description: Must be enrolled in a law school,

fields.name: [LOCAL] Burger King Scholars
fields.description: These scholarships can be used for college, community college, vocational school, technical school (or pretty much any other post-secondary institution!).

fields.name: [LOCAL] Point Foundation: College Scholarships for LGBTQ Students
fields.description: Students who have academic achievement, personal merit, leadership, involvement in the LGBTQ community, professional experiences, financial need, marginalization, personal and future goals are all taken into consideration. High School Senior

fields.name: [LOCAL] Microsoft Scholarship Program
fields.description: Must have a 3.0 GPA or higher. Must be African-American, Hispanic, or Native American sophomores or juniors pursuing studies in STEM, full-time undergraduate pursuing environmental careers at historically Black college/university. Goal statement also needed.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Gary Yoshimura Scholarship- PRSSA
fields.description: Be pursuing a higher education in the public relations field. Have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Be a PRSSA member.

fields.name: [LOCAL] The Sam and Helen R. Walton Award
fields.description: Congregations, presbyteries and synods to nominate new church developments that are working in creative ways to bring the gospel to their local communities.

fields.name: [LOCAL] The Princeton Prize in Race Relations
fields.description: Must be a high school student in the participating regions (Seattle is one of them)

fields.name: [LOCAL] AWM Essay Contest
fields.description: Students in middle school, high school, and college undergrads

fields.name: [LOCAL] Yukon & Clemence Chow Scholarship
fields.description: Full-time undergraduate or graduate student with financial need. Evidence the appropriate academic record and motivation

fields.name: [LOCAL] Ellen Masin Persina Scholarship for Minorities in Journalism
fields.description: Journalism (newspapers, radio, TV, magazine, trade paper) Scholarships for talented minorities

fields.name: [LOCAL] Joe Francomano Scholarship
fields.description:
Be high school seniors graduating before June 30th, 
-Have minimum grade point averages of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale 
- Have demonstrated leadership and excellent extracurricular and community activities
- Financial need

fields.name: [LOCAL] Frank Kazmierczak Memorial Migrant Scholarship
fields.description: Post-secondary scholarship assistance to a migrant student who wishes to pursue a career in teaching.

fields.name: [LOCAL] American Physiological Society Undergraduate Summer Research Fellowship
fields.description: Applicants must have an over-all GPA of 3.0. Applicants must be full-time undergraduate students with little or no laboratory research experience. The laboratory host must be an APS member in good standing. Selection of participants is based on academic merit and the availability of appropriate faculty mentors. Special consideration is given to applicants whose socioeconomic background, access to educational opportunities, and other life experiences suggest that they would especially benefit from this type of program.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Best Buy @15 Scholarship Program
fields.description: Applicants must be currently in grades 9-12 living in the United States or Puerto Rico, have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 (on a 4.0 scale), and demonstrate commitment to and involvement in community volunteer service or work experience. Selection is based on academic performance and exemplary community volunteer service or work experience. Consideration may also be given to participation and leadership in school activities. Financial need is not considered. Best Buy employees and relatives of employees who meet the requirements are eligible to apply.

fields.name: [LOCAL] SPIE Scholarship Program
fields.description: Must be a Student Member of SPIE.

fields.name: [LOCAL] UFCW Local 21 Scholarship
fields.description: In order to be eligible for a scholarship, you must be a current member of UFCW 21, or the dependent, spouse, or domestic

fields.name: [LOCAL] Society of Plastics Engineers Scholarship
fields.description: The SPE Foundation, an affiliate of the Society of Plastics Engineers, offers numerous scholarships to students who have demonstrated or expressed an interest in the plastics industry. They must be majoring in or taking courses that would be beneficial to a career in the plastics industry. This would include, but is not limited to, plastics engineering, polymer science, chemistry, physics, chemical engineering, mechanical engineering, and industrial engineering. All applicants must be in good standing with their colleges.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Hyperthermia - International HyTech Leadership Scholarship
fields.description: Awarded to a graduate student pursuing an advanced degree in engineering management within the welding and cutting industry. Applicant must have completed a BS degree or be in the final year. Needs to create login account.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Matsuo Bridge Company, Ltd. of Japan Scholarship
fields.description: Applicatn must be a minimum of 18 years of age; must have a high school diploma; have a 3.0 GPA average; must be enrolled full time in an accredited college or university in the U.S. Must create a profile in American Welding Society Scholarship Application System. The award will be available to students nationwide; however, priority will be given to individuals residing in the states of California, Texas, Oregon or Washington. (A resident is defined as having lived in a specified area for a minimum of one year.)

fields.name: [LOCAL] Past President Scholarship
fields.description: Individuals who have served as AWS President, supplemented by contributions from the American Welding Society, in recognition of the years of dedication given by those who have served as President.

fields.name: [LOCAL] James A. Turner, Jr., Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: Awarded to a full-time student pursuing a minimum four-year bachelor of business degree, leading to a management career in welding store operations or a welding distributorship. Applicants must have at least a high school diploma and be employed by a welding store or distributorship at least 10 hours a week. Must create a profile in American Welding Society Scholarship Application System

fields.name: [LOCAL] ISA Educational Foundation Scholarships
fields.description: Recipients of awards are full-time college or university students in either a graduate, undergraduate, or 2 yr. degree program with at least an overall GPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale. Students should be enrolled in a program in automation and control or a closely related field.

fields.name: [LOCAL] National Commission for Cooperative Education
fields.description: Have a cumulative high school GPA of 3.5 or better on a 4.0 scale. Apply and be accepted for the 2013-2014 academic year at one of the WACE Partner Institutions listed.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Dr. Flowers MCAT Scholarship (Latino Medical Student Association)
fields.description: Pre-Medical Student LMSA Members. Register on-line as a Pre-Medical LMSA member, demonstrate a history of leadership and/ or service to the Latino Community, and be in good 10 academic standing at your undergraduate institution: Stanford School of Medicine, UC San Diego, UC Davis, UC San Francisco, UC Irvine, University of Arizona, UCLA, University of Southern California, UCLA– Charles Drew School of Medicine, University of Utah, Western University of Health Sciences, University of Washington, OHSU

fields.name: [LOCAL] Vegetarian Resource Group Scholarship
fields.description: U.S. high school students who have promoted vegetarianism in their schools and/or communities.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Que Llueva Café Scholarship
fields.description: High school senior, must be undocumented

fields.name: [LOCAL] The Lowe’s Scholarship
fields.description: high school seniors who intend to enroll full-time in an undergraduate course of study in the U'S, must have a 3.25 GPA of above

fields.name: [LOCAL] Optimist International Essay Contest
fields.description: Youth under the age of 19 who have not yet graduated from high school or the equivalent.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Society of Plastic Engineers Scholarship Program
fields.description: full-time undergraduate students in either a four-year college or a two-year technical program or enrolled in a graduate program. Demonstrate financial need,  must be majoring in or taking courses that are beneficial to a career in the plastics/polymer industry.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Aweber Email Marketing Scholarship
fields.description: High school seniors, full-time college freshman, sophomores, and juniors

fields.name: [LOCAL] Washington State Opporunity Scholarship
fields.description: The Washington State Opportunity Scholarship (WSOS) supports low- and middle-income students pursuing eligible, high-demand majors in science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) and health care, and encourages recipients to work in Washington state once they complete their degrees. Must be a Washington state resident and have earned a high school dimploma or GED from a Washington State high school or instititution.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Glenn Miller Scholarship
fields.description: Must be instrumentalists or vocalist.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Blacks at Microsoft Scholarships
fields.description: Be a high-school senior of African descent (for example, African American, African, or Ethiopian). Plan to attend a four-year college or university in the fall of the year following high-school graduation. Plan to pursue a bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, computer information systems, or select business programs Have a cumulative GPA of 3.3 or higher. Require financial assistance to attend college.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Barbara Wiedner and Dorothy Vandercook Peace Scholarship
fields.description: High school senior or college freshman. Be related to peace and social justice, nuclear disarmament, and/or conflict resolution.

fields.name: [LOCAL] SEG Foundation Scholarships
fields.description: A student must meet one of the following requirements: Attending high school and planning to enter college next fall. An undergraduate or graduate college student whose grades are above average. A student must intend to pursue a college curriculum directed toward a career in applied geophysics or a closely related field, such as geosciences, physics, geology, or earth and environmental sciences

fields.name: [LOCAL] Society of Exploration Geophysics Foundation
fields.description: High school senior, college graduates and undergraduates with a GPA above average, student must intend to pursue a college curriculum directed toward a career in applied geophysics or a closely related field.

fields.name: [LOCAL] United Agribusiness League & United Agricultural Scholarship
fields.description: Applicants must be affiliated with UAL or UABT, either through a member or an employee of a member. GPA 2.5 or higher

fields.name: [LOCAL] Japanese American Citizens League Entering Awards
fields.description: Every applicant must be an active National JACL member. JACL Membership is open to everyone of any ethnic background. Full time at a college, university, trade school, business school, or any other institution of higher learning within the United States at the undergraduate or graduate school level in the fall of 2013.

fields.name: [LOCAL] 10,000 Degrees Undergraduate Scholarship
fields.description: High school seniors, college undergraduates

fields.name: [LOCAL] Alexander Hamilton Friends Association
fields.description: 0utstanding high school juniors, college bound, strong record of community service

fields.name: [LOCAL] dEACTIVATED Athlete Milk Mustache of the Year (SAMMY)
fields.description: Must demonstrate excellence in athletics  Must demonstrate excellence in academics. Must hold at least one leadership position. Must be involved in community service. Must drink milk.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Hellenic Times Scholarship
fields.description: Must be enrolled in an accredited College or University for the academic year 2013-14. Applicants may be graduate or undergraduate students. Must be of Greek descent, and between the ages of 17 and 25 as of May, 2013. Students receiving a full scholarship from any other source, or a partial scholarship exceeding 50% of their annual tuition, are ineligible.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Alliance/Merck Ciencia (Science) Hispanic Scholars Program
fields.description: Hispanic college students from all 50 states, the District of Columbia, U.S. territories and Puerto Rico pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field major are invited to apply for a $2,000 one-time scholarship of which 25 will be awarded in the Spring of 2013.

fields.name: [LOCAL] ASHG DNA Day Essay Contest
fields.description: High school students

fields.name: [LOCAL] Albert Lee Wright, Jr. Memorial Migrant Scholarship
fields.description: Scholarships will be given to graduating high school students entering college for the first time.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Leonard M. Perryman Communications Scholarship
fields.description: Must be United Methodist undergraduate studying religion journalism or mass communications.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Cruzando Fronteras/Ayudando ala Comunidad Scholarship
fields.description: High school seniors from Sacramento, California, must be undocumented, GPA 2.5 or higher

fields.name: [LOCAL] Yoshiyama Award for Exemplary Service to the Community
fields.description: Graduating high school seniors in the United States and its territories. You must demonstrate self-motivation, leadership, creativity, dedication and a commitment to pursuing community service to be eligible for this award. This award is based primarily on the impact of your community service activities, and you must be nominated by someone familiar with your service. GPA, SAT scores and school club memberships are not considered in the selection process.
fields.website: No updated information can be found on scholarship- may be defunct.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Migrant Health Scholarship Award
fields.description: Applicants must interested in pursuing or continuing their career in the migrant health field and employees at a Community/Migrant Health Center. While we encourage individuals with a farmworker background to apply, it is not a requirement.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Anthem Essay Contest
fields.description: Must be in 8th, 9th, or 10th grade

fields.name: [LOCAL] B. Davis Scholarship
fields.description: Must be high school seniors and juniors This Scholarship is available to all high school juniors as well as currently registered in any post secondary institution.

fields.name: [LOCAL] TRENZA Scholarships
fields.description: Graduating Chicana/Latina high school seniors from California, offered by undergraduate students

fields.name: [LOCAL] A . Patrick Charnon Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: Applicant must be admitted or enrolled in a accredited undergraduate program in a four-year college or university in the

fields.name: [LOCAL] The American Academy of Chefs® The American Culinary Federation
fields.description: Be an exemplary student. Have or maintain a cumulative GPA of 2.5 or higher.  Be a high school senior eligible to graduate the same year as the scholarship application date.  Be currently accepted to an accredited, postsecondary college, with a major in either culinary or pastry arts, or be an ACF registered apprentice

fields.name: [LOCAL] Automotive Aftermarket Scholarship
fields.description: Qualified applicants must be a graduating high school senior, or have graduated from high school or received a GED certificate.  There is no minimum GPA requirement for GAAS awards. Applicants must be enrolled or planning to enroll as a full time student in a 2 or 4 year college or an ASE/NATEF certified post secondary automotive, collision repair, or heavy duty program.

fields.name: [LOCAL] YouthPower365 Scholarships
fields.description: Create profile to recieve list of scholarship opportunities

fields.name: [LOCAL] Scholarships for Foster Youth
fields.description: Have been in public or private foster care for the 12 consecutive months prior to their 18th birthday; OR have been adopted or placed into legal guardianship from foster care after their 16th birthday; OR they must have been orphaned for at least one year at the time of their 18th birthday. Have been accepted into or expect to be accepted into an accredited. And, be under the age of 25 on March 31, 2017 if you have not previously received scholarship funding from FC2S. Have been in foster care or orphaned while living in the United States.  U.S. citizenship is not required

fields.name: [LOCAL] Marriott Scholars Program
fields.description: Hispanic or African American; enrolled full-time in an accredited four-year college or university with a hospitality management program as an incoming college freshman, first year freshman or community college transfer; pursuing or planning to pursue a degree within the hospitality management, hotel management, culinary or food and beverage field; and possess a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or better on a 4.0 scale.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Fredrikson Minority Scholarship Program
fields.description: Must be a first year law student. The scholarship is awarded based on law school performance, professional references, work and other activities, writing samples and personal interviews.

fields.name: [LOCAL] LULAC National Scholastic Achievement Awards
fields.description: GPA of 3.5 or better on a 4.0 scale or equivalent, and if the student is an entering freshman. 29 or higher on the ACT test, or 1350 or higher on the SAT test.

fields.name: [LOCAL] LULAC Honors Awards
fields.description: GPA of 3.0 or better on a 4.0 scale or equivalent, and if the student is an entering freshman.23 or higher on the ACT test, or 1100 or higher on the SAT.

fields.name: [LOCAL] LULAC General Awards
fields.description: Grades and academic performance will serve as indicators of potential. Student applications must be mailed directly to a local participating LULAC Council in your area.

fields.name: [LOCAL] L. Ron Hubbard’s Future Writers Library Contest
fields.description: Students of any age are eligible to enter this writing contest as long as they are amateur writers. Students must submit a piece with a science fiction, fantasy, or horror with fantastic elements theme. The Contest has four quarters, beginning on October 1, January 1, April 1 and July 1

fields.name: [LOCAL] Gloria Barron Prize for Young Heroes
fields.description: must be between 8 to 18 years old and be nominated for this prize. Currently working on an inspiring service project or have done so within the past 12 months.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Davis-Putter Scholarship
fields.description: For college student who are activists in the US

fields.name: [LOCAL] The American Nuclear Society Scholarship Program
fields.description: Graduating high-school seniors who have enrolled, full-time, in college courses and are pursuing a degree in nuclear engineering or have the intent to pursue a degree in nuclear engineering.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Academy of Motion Picture Students Academy Awards
fields.description: REGION ONE: Alaska, California, Hawaii, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, Washington, Wyoming. The filmmaker must be a full-time student in a degree-granting program at an accredited** U.S. college or university.  The film must have been made in a teacher-student relationship within the curricular structure of that institution.  If the filmmaker has graduated or left such a program, the film may be submitted no later than one year from the filmmaker's date of departure.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Transportation Clubs International Scholarships
fields.description: Graduating high school seniors and college undergraduate students accepted to or currently enrolled at accredited institutions of higher learning in degree programs in the fields of transportation logistics, supply-chain management, traffic management, transportation safety and/or related transportation industry operations and services.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Mary Quon Moy Ing Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: Applicants must be a graduating high school senior, undergraduate, or graduate student enrolled full time with at least 12 credit units each semester for the fall of 2016 and spring of 2017. Applicants must be currently taking or planning to take journalism courses and/or pursing journalism as a career.

fields.name: [LOCAL] NAHJ Maria Elena Salinas Scholarship
fields.description: Students who demonstrated a strong desire to pursue a career as a Spanish-language broadcast journalist. This scholarship is awarded to college undergraduate and graduate students.

fields.name: [LOCAL] NAHJ Geraldo Rivera Scholarship
fields.description: College senior or graduate student pursuing a career in English or Spanish-language TV broadcast journalism.

fields.name: [LOCAL] NAHJ Soledad O’Brien Scholarship
fields.description: Undergraduate or graduate students pursuing a career in TV broadcast journalism.

fields.name: [LOCAL] NAHJ Jane Velez-Mitchell Scholarship
fields.description: Undergraduate or graduate students pursuing a career in TV broadcast journalism.

fields.name: [LOCAL] NAHJ General Scholarship
fields.description: College-bound high school seniors, college undergraduates and graduate students pursuing careers in English or Spanish-language print, photo, broadcast or online journalism.

fields.name: [LOCAL] NAHJ Ford Motor Company Scholarships
fields.description: Students pursuing careers in print, broadcast, online and visual journalism. College bound high school seniors, undergraduates, or graduate students. Must have 2.0 average. Each of the following criteria is weighed equally when NAHJ considers which students to select: Commitment to field of journalism, academic achievement, financial need, and awareness of community.

fields.name: [LOCAL] NAHJ PepsiCo Scholarships
fields.description: Students pursuing careers in print, broadcast, online and visual journalism. College-bound high school seniors, college undergraduates and graduate students are eligible as long as they have a 2.0 average. Commitment to the field of journalism, academic achievement, financial need, awareness of the community.

fields.name: [LOCAL] NAHJ Ruben Salazar Scholarships
fields.description: College-bound high school seniors, college undergraduates and graduate students pursuing careers in English or Spanish-language print, photo, broadcast or online journalism. Interest in journalism career and financial need. Application may be in English or Spanish. Commitment to field of journalism, academic achievement, financial need, and awareness of community.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Educational Advancement Foundation, Merit
[LOCAL] Educational Advancement Foundation, Financial Need
[LOCAL] Gloria and Joseph Mattera National Scholarship Fund for Migrant Children
fields.description: High school senior or college students are able to apple, migrant youth with a background in migrant formwork, agricultural, and have financial need. To assist financially those migrant youth who have the potential and the desire to further their education to achieve their personal and career goals. Eligible applicants must be entering or enrolled in college or other types of post-secondary programs, high school dropouts or potential dropouts.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Troy Women’s Association  Scholarship
fields.description: The Troy Women’s Association (TWA) awards several college scholarships to females graduating from high school, returning to school, or continuing their college education.  Applicants must demonstrate community service and have a financial need. One of the scholarships, the Donna Smith Scholarship, is awarded to an applicant who has demonstrated community service and is pursuing a degree in business or accounting.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Holocaust Remembrance Project Essay
fields.description: This contest is open to all students age 19 and under. Are currently enrolled as a high school student in grades 9-12 (including home schooled students), or who are high school seniors who may graduate high school any time during the application year, or who are enrolled in a high school equivalency program. Are residents of the United States, Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, or Guam.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Fountainhead Essay Contest
fields.description: High school juniors and seniors

fields.name: [LOCAL] The Hispanic Engineers National Achieve Award
fields.description: High school seniors and college students who are in/interested in STEM related majors, must be of Hispanic origin and/or must significantly participate in and promote organizations and activities in the Hispanic community.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Bill Dickey Scholarship
fields.description: High school seniors already in our database as well as undergraduate students that previously received a scholarship as a freshman are eligible to apply. Awards are based on academic achievement, entrance exam scores, financial need, references, evidence of community service, and golfing ability.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Ferdinand Torres Scholarship
fields.description: This scholarship is for students who are legally blind. To qualify for this scholarship, applicants must be full-time undergraduate or graduate students. Strong preference will be given to new immigrants to the US. Applicants must reside in the United States, but need not be citizens of the United States.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Los Hermanos de Stanford Scholarship
fields.description: Latino/a students graduating from high school with plans to attend any 2-year or 4-year institution of higher learning (students planning to attend Community College are very welcome to apply).

fields.name: [LOCAL] The American Academy of Chefs® The American Culinary Federation- College
fields.description: Have and maintain a cumulative GPA of 2.50 or higher. Be currently enrolled in an accredited, postsecondary college, with a major in either culinary or pastry arts, or be an ACFEF registered apprentice. Have completed a grading or marking period. Have a career goal of becoming a chef or pastry chef.

fields.name: [LOCAL] The Byron Hanke Fellowship
fields.description: Hanke Fellowship applicants must be enrolled at the time of application, and through the period of research, in an accredited master's, doctoral, or law program in the United States of America or Canada. Students of all disciplines are welcome to apply for the Hanke Fellowship, provided their studies relate to community associations/ common interest communities generally and to the topic of the candidate's proposed community associations research project.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers Scholarship
fields.description: Latino/a high school graduating seniors, undergraduate students, and graduate students who demonstrate both significant motivation and aptitude for a career in STEM.

fields.name: [LOCAL] AHETEMS General Scholarship
fields.description: Be a high school or undergraduate student, Hispanic decent, Be accepted into or attending an accredited 2-year or 4-year college or university in the US. Be enrolled full-time. Minimum GPA: 3.0 on a 4.0 for high school seniors and undergraduates; 3.00 for graduate students. Must be a SHPE member to apply. Major in STEM.

fields.name: [LOCAL] General Scholarship
fields.description: Applicant must be of Hispanic-descent accepted into or attending an accredited 2-year or 4-year college or university in the U.S. or Puerto Rico, and be enrolled full-time during the academic year. High school graduating seniors must be graduating from an accredited U.S. high school with a diploma. Applicant must possess a minimum GPA: 3.00 on a 4.0 for high school seniors and undergraduates; 3.25 on a 4.0 scale for graduate students, and must major in STEM related field, and be pursuing your first bachelors, masters or doctoral degree. Applicant must be a SHPE member.

fields.name: [LOCAL] National Association Hispanic Nurses
fields.description: Must be Hispanic and  must be a NAHN member for at least 6 months previous to the submission deadline.

fields.name: [LOCAL] ASHRAE High School Senior Scholarship
fields.description: Applicants must be high school seniors who have been accepted into a pre-engineering, engineering, or engineering technology program at a post-secondary educational institution that meets the followling criteria: The institution hosts a recognized ASHRAE Student Branch. The program is accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) or the Partnership for Air-Conditioning, Heating, Refrigeration Accreditation (PAHRA) in the USA. The program is accredited by an equivalent agency outside the USA that is part of The Washington or Sydney Accord or has a signed Memorandum of Understanding with ABET. Must have a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, and/or have a class standing no less than the top 30%.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Council for International Cooperation (CIC) Anna Chennault Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a high school senior or currently college student. Candidates will be judged on the basis of academic achievement, demonstrated journalistic ability, commitment to the field of journalism and/or sensitivity to Asian American and Pacific Islander Issues.

fields.name: [LOCAL] James Beard Foundation
fields.description: High school seniors and high school graduates, interested in culinary

fields.name: [LOCAL] PRSA Diversity Multicultural Scholarship-PRSSA
fields.description: You must be of African-American/Black, Hispanic/Latino, Asian, Native American, Alaskan Native or Pacific Islander ancestry. Must be registered as a full-time undergraduate student at an accredited four-year college or university. A major or minor in public relations is also preferred. A student who attends a school that does not offer a public relations degree or program must be enrolled in a communications degree program (e.g., journalism or mass communications). You must have attained, by Fall 2016, at least junior status and have at most one full term remaining. You also must have earned and maintained a minimum 3.0 grade point average on a 4.0 point scale in all courses.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Center for Student Opportunity (CSO) Scholarship
fields.description: Graduating high school seniors. Attending an eligible four-year college or university partnered with CSO in the fall of 2013. First-generation and/or limited financial resources - students who seek financial aid and scholarships for college, and/or underrepresented/minority groups,st udents who identify as African-American/Black, American Indian/Alaska native, Hispanic/Latino, and Asian/Pacific Islander

fields.name: [LOCAL] John D. Graham Scholarship-PRSSA
fields.description: Academic achievement in public relations and overall studies. Demonstrated leadership. Practical experience in internships, other work/service. Commitment to public relations, particularly as expressed in the candidate’s statements in the application form.Writing skills demonstrated throughout the application form.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Marcia Silverman Minority Student Award-PRSSA
fields.description: Be enrolled in a journalism program, public relations studies or courses preparing for a career in public relations. Be entering your senior year of undergraduate studies this fall. Have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Be of African-American/Black, Hispanic/Latino, Asian, Native American, Alaskan Native or Pacific Islander ancestry.

fields.name: [LOCAL] IFMA Foundation Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a full time undergraduate student as defined by your university at the time of submitting the application and at the time of receiving the scholarship.  Must be enrolled in a facility management (or related field) degree program in an accredited four-year Bachelor (undergraduate) program. Undergraduate students must have completed two years of university studies to be eligible for consideration. May not be employed full time.  Must have a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 3.2 or be able to document that your academic study achievement is at an 85% of highest grading evaluation maximum scale.  This differs from country to country. Applicants awarded a scholarship must attend IFMA’s World Workplace Conference (WWP) and Exhibition as well as attend educational sessions associated with WWP (costs included in scholarship)

fields.name: [LOCAL] U.S. Bank Internet Scholarship Program
fields.description: Has a minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale

fields.name: [LOCAL] National Council of La Raza – Best Buy Emerging Latino Leaders Scholarship Program
fields.description: High school seniors, must be Hispanic, GPA 2.0 or higher

fields.name: [LOCAL] Kor Memorial Scholarship
fields.description: College students in a field of language study

fields.name: [LOCAL] Berrien Fragos Thorn Arts Scholarship for Migrant Farmworkers
fields.description: Must be at least 16 years old, history of movement to obtain work in agriculture is REQUIRED. Have demonstrated a certain level of academic achievement and potential for college success.

fields.name: [LOCAL] National Sculpture Society Scholarship
fields.description: Students of sculpture. Please note that work that is inspired by nature - or figurative or realist sculpture - is preferred. It is suggested that students take at least one college level art class before applying. The educational institution the student attends must be an accredited U.S. institution.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Lawrence G. Foster Award for Excellence in Public Relations- PRSSA
fields.description: All PRSSA Members are welcomed to apply

fields.name: [LOCAL] Stephen D. Pisinski Memorial Scholarship-PRSSA
fields.description: Be a journalism, communications or public relations major. Be in your junior or senior year of college. Have at least a 3.3 overall grade point average on a 4.0 scale. Be a PRSSA member.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Betsy Plank/PRSSA Scholarships
fields.description: You must be a PRSSA member in your junior or senior year of college, preparing for a career in public relations to apply for this award. Academic achievement in public relations and overall studies. Demonstrated leadership. Practical experience, e.g. internships, other work/service, student firm work Commitment to public relations, particularly as expressed in the candidate's statement.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Abbott and Fenner Scholarship
fields.description: Available to all high school juniors and seniors as well as all students currently registered in any accredited post secondary institution.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Collegiate Inventors Competition
fields.description: The entry must be the original idea and work product of a student or team of students with his or her university advisor and must not have been (1) made available to the public as a commercial product or process, (2) described in extensive detail in a publication more than one year prior to the date of submission, or (3) issued a patent more than one year prior to the date of submission. On rare occasions exceptions may be made to allow the submission of significant recent improvements to matter patented or published more than one year prior to submission of the application. The entry submitted must be written in English

fields.name: [LOCAL] Chester Burger Scholarship for Excellence in Public Relations-PRSSA
fields.description: Candidates must be enrolled or continuing in a graduate studies degree program in public relations, journalism or related fields, effective fall 2013. Candidates must have an undergraduate GPA of at least 3.0 out of 4. Candidates do not have to be a PRSSA member to apply. The award may be used at any U.S. college or university offering a graduate program in public relations or related field. Entries will be judged by a committee of three senior public relations professionals, each of whom will represent one of the three founding organizations for this award.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Ron Culp Scholarship for Mentorship-PRSSA
fields.description: To nominate a student, he or she must be entering his or her senior year in college in Fall 2013. Must be a major in public relations, journalism, or related fields. Must be studying to prepare for a career in public relations. Must be attending a four year accredited institution. Must be in good standing as a member of a PRSSA chapter. (CHECK NOMINATION PROCESS)

fields.name: [LOCAL] Ofield Dukes Multicultural Student Award
fields.description:
Be enrolled in a journalism program, public relations studies or courses preparing for a career in public relations.
Entering your junior year of undergraduate studies this fall.Have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Demonstrate the commitment to service and social responsibility that Ofield Dukes personified. Be of African-American/Black, Hispanic/Latino, Asian, Native American, Alaskan Native or Pacific Islander ancestry.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Neumeier Family Leadership Award
fields.description: Current PRSSA member who has demonstrated an outstanding record of effective leadership in the Public Relations Student Society of America (at the chapter, regional or national level) and/or other campus or community organizations. Undergraduate or graduate student in good academic standing. Enrolled in an accredited college or university in Georgia or Florida

fields.name: [LOCAL] The BigSun Organization
fields.description: All student athletes are eligible regardless of the sport they are engaged in. The student must be a high school senior or be attending a post secondary institute. All essay submissions should be sent to: athleticawards@bigsunathletics.com

fields.name: [LOCAL] Manos de Esperanza Scholarship
fields.description:
Demostrate community service.Have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 on undergraduate college course work. 
(Must have completed a minimum of 12 college units, after high school graduation. Be enrolled full-time and for the following academic year in an accredited college, university, or community college in one of the following California counties: Alameda-Contra Costa- Fresno-Marin-Monterey-Napa-Sacramento- San Francisco-San Mateo-Santa Clara-Santa Cruz-Solano-Sonoma-Tulare-Yolo

fields.name: [LOCAL] Barbara Mandigo Kelly Peace Poetry Awards
fields.description: Annual series of awards to encourage poets to explore and illuminate positive visions of peace and the human spirit. The Poetry Awards include three age categories: Adult, Youth 13-18, and Youth 12 & Under.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Migrant Farmworker Baccalaureate Scholarship
fields.description: Deserving student with a history of migrating for employment in agriculture who has successfully completed one year of college. Financial need and scholastic achievement.

fields.name: [LOCAL] MALDEF's DREAM Act Student Activist Program
fields.description: Students in college or graduate school. Student leaders who have been outstanding advocates for the DREAM Act and all immigrant rights

fields.name: [LOCAL] Hands Along the Nile
fields.description: The Hands Along the Nile Essay Contest is available to full-time undergraduate and graduate students who attend an accredited college or university in the United States. High school students entering college in the fall  are also eligible. To be eligible for this award, you must submit an essay of no more than 2,500 words on the topic: "How is community development in the Middle East important to the U.S.? Why is it particularly crucial to focus on Egypt?" Additional guidelines and rules are available on the sponsor's site.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Mexican American Grocers Association Scholarship
fields.description: Applicant must be Hispanic and a full-time student, have a minimum 2.5 GPA, and demonstrate financial need. Applicant must submit official transcripts. Recipient must be able to attend the Scholarship Awards Banquet.

fields.name: [LOCAL] From Failure to Promise Scholarship Essay Contest
fields.description: Contestants must be high school seniors, undergraduate, and graduate-level college students with at least a 2.5 cumulative GPA, pursuing or planning to pursue a degree at an accredited college or university in the United States or Canada. Please email us at scholarships@fromfailuretopromise.com for additonal questions or concerns.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Vancouver Restaurant Scholarship
fields.description: Full time students in high school or college, 15-21 years old

fields.name: [LOCAL] Zonta Club of Yakima Valley Young Women in Public Affairs Award
fields.description: Given to one outstanding senior girl from one of the Yakima Valley high schools each spring. The money may be applied to studies at any community college or four year college.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Zonta Club of Everett Foundation
fields.description: Recipient must be a resident of Snohomish County. Recipient must have financial need. Recipient must meet the guidelines of a “displaced homemaker”, someone who has been in the home and dependent on someone else’s income. Must be single, separated, divorced, widowed or, if married the spouse has become unemployed, disabled or retired. Should have a realistic career plan that would lead her to economic self-sufficiency and an educational goal to meet this plan. Must be high school graduate or have a General Education Development (GED) equivalent. If you need additional information concerning the scholarships, please contact info@zontaeverett.org

fields.name: [LOCAL] Regeneron Science Talent Search Society for Science and the Public
fields.description: Talented U.S. high school seniors to pursue independent research in science, math, engineering and medicine.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Atlas Shrugged Essay Competition
fields.description: Entrant must be a 12th Grader, College Undergraduate, or Graduate Student.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Robin M. Urbanski Memorial Scholarlship
fields.description: Must be in good standing as a member of a PRSSA Chapter. Must be entering his or her junior or senior year in college in fall 2016, be a major in public relations, journalism, or a related field, be studying to prepare for a career in public relations,possess a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale, be attending a four year accredited institution. This scholarship is designed to honor a student for his/her mentoring of others and his/her commitment to public relations.

fields.name: [LOCAL] AHIMA Foundation Merit Scholarship
fields.description: Member of the American Health Information Management Association (AHIMA), Enrolled in a community college or university, completed 24 credits, GPA 3.5, Have not been awarded any AHIMA Foundation scholarship for the academic degree being sought through this application.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Xerox Technical Minority Scholarship
fields.description: Must be a full time student at a four-year institution, must have a B average grades, must be following technical science or engineering. You must identify as Black, Asian, Pacific Islander, Native American, Alaskan or Hispanic.

fields.name: [LOCAL] AES Scholarship
fields.description: Scholarships are intended for our future leaders across a wide spectrum of fields of study. This award is available to high school seniors and all students attending a post secondary educational facility. You are not required to be taking Engineering courses to be eligible.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Brand Essay Competition
fields.description: Anyone in the world may apply

fields.name: [LOCAL] La Unidad Latina Foundation Scholarship
fields.description: Must have current enrollment in an eligible bachelor’s or master’s degree program at an accredited four-year college or university (see website for “eligible degrees”). Must have completed at least one full-time year of study for undergraduate applicants, and at least one full-time semester of study for graduate applicants. Must reside in the United States

fields.name: [LOCAL] Brickfish: Me and My BFF contest
fields.description: To enter into the contest you are required to submit a photo of you and your best friend. The Brickfish Me and my BFF contest is open to students over the age of 15.  In order to participate in the contest you must be a resident of the US or Canada

fields.name: [LOCAL] Guidepost Young Writers Program
fields.description: The Guidepost Young Writers Contest is available to high school juniors and seniors.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Fred Luster Sr. Education Foundation
fields.description:
Must be an undergraduate student
Must attend a university or a four-year college
Must study full-time
Must not be attending high school currently
Restricted to students studying Cosmetology

fields.name: [LOCAL] Amelia Earhart Fellowship
fields.description: Women pursuing a Ph.D./doctoral degree with a superior academic record in the field of aerospace‐related sciences and aerospace‐related engineering

fields.name: [LOCAL] ASHRAE Undergraduate Engineering Scholarships+
fields.description:
Scholarships are available to full-time undergraduate engineering or pre-engineering students pursuing a Bachelor of Science or Engineering degree in a course of study that has traditionally been a preparatory curriculum for the HVAC&R profession.  Applicants must have a cumulative Grade Point Average (GPA) of at least 3.0 on a scale where 4.0 is the highest and/or a class standing of no less than the top 30% and meet at least one of the following criteria:
the institution host

fields.name: [LOCAL] Kate Neal Kinley Memorial Fellowship
fields.description: Fellowships will be awarded upon the basis of unusual promise in the Fine Arts as attested by: high attainment in the applicant’s major field of study as evidenced by academic marks and quality of work submitted or performed. High attainment in related cultural fields as evidenced by academic marks, the character, merit, and suitability of the program proposed by the applicant excellence of personality, seriousness of purpose, and good moral character

fields.name: [LOCAL] Love Your Body: 2016 Poster Contest
fields.description: Women, elementary, middle school, high school, and college students

fields.name: [LOCAL] Elie Wiesel Prize in Ethics
fields.description: Registered undergraduate full-time juniors or seniors at accredited four-year colleges or universities in the United States.

fields.name: [LOCAL] Jack Kent Cooke Foundation Undergraduate Transfer Scholarships
fields.description:
Be a current student at an accredited U.S. community college or two-year institution with sophomore status by December 31, 2016, or a recent graduate (since spring 2012).
